content: I have a list `a = [32, 37, 28, 30, 37, 25, 27, 24, 35, 55, 23, 31, 55, 21, 40, 18, 50, 35, 41, 49, 37, 19, 40, 41, 31]` and I am trying to find all the positions of the maximum value in this list. The maximum element is 55 and it occurs twice, at positions 9 and 12. How can I find the positions of this maximum value in this list?

To find all the positions of the maximum value in the list, you can iterate through the list and collect the indices where the maximum value occurs. Here is a simple Python code snippet to do that:

```python
a = [32, 37, 28, 30, 37, 25, 27, 24, 35, 55, 23, 31, 55, 21, 40, 18, 50, 35, 41, 49, 37, 19, 40, 41, 31]

# Find the maximum value in the list
max_value = max(a)

# Find all positions (indices) of the maximum value
positions = [index for index, value in enumerate(a) if value == max_value]

print("The maximum value occurs at positions:", positions)
```

This code first determines the maximum value in the list using the `max()` function. Then, it uses a list comprehension along with `enumerate()` to find all indices where the value equals the maximum value, storing these indices in the `positions` list. When you run this code, it will output:

```
The maximum value occurs at positions: [9, 12]
```
